36 __author__ = "mferguson@willowgarage.com (Michael Ferguson)"
37 
38 import rospy
39 from rosserial_python import SerialClient, RosSerialServer
40 import multiprocessing
41 
42 import sys
43 
44 if __name__=="__main__":
45 
46  rospy.init_node("serial_node_arduinoMega")
47  rospy.loginfo("ROS Serial Python Node")
48 
49  port_name = rospy.get_param('~port','/dev/ttyACM0')
50  baud = int(rospy.get_param('~baud','57600'))
51 
52  # TODO: should these really be global?
53  tcp_portnum = int(rospy.get_param('/rosserial_embeddedlinux/tcp_port', '11411'))
54  fork_server = rospy.get_param('/rosserial_embeddedlinux/fork_server', False)
55 
56  # TODO: do we really want command line params in addition to parameter server params?
57  sys.argv = rospy.myargv(argv=sys.argv)
58  if len(sys.argv) == 2 :
59  port_name = sys.argv[1]
60  if len(sys.argv) == 3 :
61  tcp_portnum = int(sys.argv[2])
62 
63  if port_name == "tcp" :
64  server = RosSerialServer(tcp_portnum, fork_server)
65  rospy.loginfo("Waiting for socket connections on port %d" % tcp_portnum)
66  try:
67  server.listen()
68  except KeyboardInterrupt:
69  rospy.loginfo("got keyboard interrupt")
70  finally:
71  rospy.loginfo("Shutting down")
72  for process in multiprocessing.active_children():
73  rospy.loginfo("Shutting down process %r", process)
74  process.terminate()
75  process.join()
76  rospy.loginfo("All done")
77 
78  else : # Use serial port
79  rospy.loginfo("Connecting to %s at %d baud" % (port_name,baud) )
80  client = SerialClient(port_name, baud)
81  try:
82  client.run()
83  except KeyboardInterrupt:
84  pass
